sentence.text: A 5-y-old boy, who was the third child of consanguineous parents, was evaluated for short stature.
He had sparse hair since birth.
His development was normal and he was attending normal school.
On examination, he had hypopigmented sparse hair.
He had short thumb and 5th digit clinodactyly bilaterally and pectus excavatum.
He did not have any organomegaly.
His anthropometry showed weight of 10 kg (− 4 SD for age), height of 81 cm (−5 SD for age) and head circumference of 47 cm (−4 SD for age).
His hemogram and serum alkaline phosphatase were normal.
Radiographs revealed metaphyseal irregularities at knees.
Mutation analysis of RMRP was done by sequencing and a homozygous mutation, g.70 A > G, [4] was identified.
